dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Vice President Mike Biden just accused China of meddling in the midterm elections, which is a huge escalation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Vice President Mike Biden just accused China of meddling in the midterm elections, which is a huge escalation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Vice President Mike Pence launched a cannonball across the bow of Chinas ship of state last week. He said the country was meddling in the midterm elections.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he specifically said they want President Biden gone through impeachment—that's a really direct charge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he specifically said they want President Biden gone through impeachment-that's a really direct charge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They want President Trump gone in an impeachment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And if that's true, it opens the door to sanctions under Trump's executive orders or that 2017 sanctions act.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And if that's true, it opens the door to sanctions under Trump's executive orders or that twenty seventeen sanctions act.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If China was meddling, it sets the table for Washington to sanction them under two new executive orders signed by Trump and the August 2017 Countering Americas Adversaries Through Sanctions Act.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But then you've got Chinese Foreign Minister Zhao Lijian firing back, accusing Washington of interfering with Taiwan and making false claims about election meddling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then you've got Chinese Foreign Minister Zhao Lijian firing back, accusing Washington of interfering with Taiwan and making false claims about election meddling.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi accused Washington of escalating the trade conflict, interfering with Taiwan, and leveling false accusations against China regarding election interference and inserting chips in Apple products in order to spy on U.S. companies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, he said these actions have hurt mutual trust and cast a shadow over relations—pretty strong language.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, he said these actions have hurt mutual trust and cast a shadow over relations-pretty strong language.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These actions [have hurt] our mutual trust, and cast a shadow over the future of China-U.S. relations, he was quoted saying yesterday by the South China Morning Post.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the economic side isn't any better. The Shanghai stock indexes fell almost 6.7% after that weeklong holiday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the economic side isn't any better. The Shanghai stock indexes fell almost six point seven percent after that weeklong holiday.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Following a weeklong holiday in China, mainland equities fell by as much as 4.7% in some Shanghai stock indexes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oof, and the China A-shares are down over 22% year-to-date. That's gotta be hurting U.S. mutual funds tied to emerging markets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oof, and the China A-shares are down over twenty two percent year-to-date. That's gotta be hurting U.S. mutual funds tied to emerging markets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The China A-shares (ASHR) are down over 22% year-to-date, a sorry state of affairs for dozens of U.S. mutual funds benchmarked to the MSCI Emerging Markets Index and who have been mandated to reallocate a portion of portfolio funds to mainland China equities now that they are part of the MSCI EM.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly—it's been a losing bet for them, especially since MSCI inclusion forced more allocation to Chinese equities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly-it's been a losing bet for them, especially since M S C I inclusion forced more allocation to Chinese equities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, Beijing released this 36,000-word paper accusing the U.S. of seeking economic hegemony through tariffs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, Beijing released this thirty six thousand-word paper accusing the U.S. of seeking economic hegemony through tariffs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Beijing recently released a 36,000-word paper on representing the official view on U.S. trade frictions, published on Xinhua News Agency on Monday. They accused Washington of seeking economic hegemony and intimidating other countries through economic measures including tariffs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: They're basically calling it economic warfare at this point. And Finance Minister Wang Qishan admitted some provinces are feeling the trade war impact.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're basically calling it economic warfare at this point. And Finance Minister Wang Qishan admitted some provinces are feeling the trade war impact.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Finance Minister Liu Kun said that some provinces are feeling the impact of the trade war.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Though he did say China would cut around $199 billion in taxes this year to help cope.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Though he did say China would cut around one hundred ninety nine dollars billion in taxes this year to help cope.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He said China is equipped to handle it and would cut around $189 billion in taxes over the course of this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But Macquarie economists pointed out Beijing's stimulus efforts are still reactive, not proactive. They're behind the curve.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But Macquarie economists pointed out Beijing's stimulus efforts are still reactive, not proactive. They're behind the curve.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Macquarie Capital economists Larry Hu and Irene Wu wrote in a recent note that Chinese policymakers remain reactive, not proactive in conducting stimulus and add that Beijings policy loosening is still way behind the curve.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: At least the central bank promised a $120 billion injection—some might go toward propping up retail investors in A-shares.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: At least the central bank promised a one hundred twenty dollars billion injection-some might go toward propping up retail investors in A-shares.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They promised to inject $110 billion into the economy. Some of that could go to help prop up China's retail investors in the A-shares.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's the B20 group criticizing China's state-owned enterprises, saying they distort global competition.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's the B20 group criticizing China's state-owned enterprises, saying they distort global competition.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Business 20, an international business advisory group affiliated with the Group of 20, blasted Beijing over the role of state-owned enterprises in the world economy. Business 20 issued a note last week calling for an end to state-related competitive distortions, but the wording met with strong objections from the China Council for the Promotion of International Trade, a semigovernmental trade advocacy group.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which, uh, China's trade promotion council immediately objected to, demanding revisions before the G20 summit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, uh, China's trade promotion council immediately objected to, demanding revisions before the G20 summit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The China group demanded revisions to the sections covering state-owned enterprises and their role in global markets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It feels like both sides are just digging in deeper. Not on the same page—not even in the same book, honestly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It feels like both sides are just digging in deeper. Not on the same page-not even in the same book, honestly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They are not only not on the same page on trade matters, but they are also not even in the same book.

artist_script:
HostA: Vice President Mike Biden just accused China of meddling in the midterm elections, which is a huge escalation.
HostB: Yeah, and he specifically said they want President Biden gone through impeachment—that’s a really direct charge.
HostA: And if that’s true, it opens the door to sanctions under Trump’s executive orders or that 2017 sanctions act.
HostB: But then you’ve got Chinese Foreign Minister Zhao Lijian firing back, accusing Washington of interfering with Taiwan and making false claims about election meddling.
HostA: Right, he said these actions have hurt mutual trust and cast a shadow over relations—pretty strong language.
HostB: And the economic side isn’t any better. The Shanghai stock indexes fell almost 6.7% after that weeklong holiday.
HostA: Oof, and the China A-shares are down over 22% year-to-date. That’s gotta be hurting U.S. mutual funds tied to emerging markets.
HostB: Exactly—it’s been a losing bet for them, especially since MSCI inclusion forced more allocation to Chinese equities.
HostA: Meanwhile, Beijing released this 36,000-word paper accusing the U.S. of seeking economic hegemony through tariffs.
HostB: They’re basically calling it economic warfare at this point. And Finance Minister Wang Qishan admitted some provinces are feeling the trade war impact.
HostA: Though he did say China would cut around $199 billion in taxes this year to help cope.
HostB: But Macquarie economists pointed out Beijing’s stimulus efforts are still reactive, not proactive. They’re behind the curve.
HostA: At least the central bank promised a $120 billion injection—some might go toward propping up retail investors in A-shares.
HostB: And then there’s the B20 group criticizing China’s state-owned enterprises, saying they distort global competition.
HostA: Which, uh, China’s trade promotion council immediately objected to, demanding revisions before the G20 summit.
HostB: It feels like both sides are just digging in deeper. Not on the same page—not even in the same book, honestly.
